meanings.definition: The act of crossing a hybrid organism with one of its parents or an organism genetically similar to one of its parents.
meanings.sent1: Backcrossing can help maintain the desired traits in a plant.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use backcrossing to improve the quality of crops.
meanings.sent3: The tomato plant decided to try backcrossing with its parent to see who would grow taller.
meanings.sent4: In the world of plants, backcrossing is like a family reunion to strengthen the family tree.
meanings.sent5: Backcrossing is like a genetic handshake between generations.

meanings.definition: The process of breeding successive generations of a hybrid organism with one of its parents.
meanings.sent1: Backcrossing is essential in creating new plant varieties.
meanings.sent2: Geneticists study the effects of backcrossing on plant characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The corn stalk found humor in backcrossing with its parent and growing even taller.
meanings.sent4: Backcrossing is like a genetic time machine, connecting the past with the present.
meanings.sent5: Through backcrossing, plants pass down their best traits like a family heirloom.
